org.osmdroid.bonuspack.clustering
Class MarkerClusterer

java.lang.Object
  org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Overlay
      org.osmdroid.bonuspack.clustering.MarkerClusterer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.osmdroid.views.util.constants.OverlayConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridMarkerClusterer
public abstract class MarkerClusterer
extends org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Overlay

An overlay allowing to perform markers clustering. Usage: put your markers inside with add(Marker), and add the MarkerClusterer to the map overlays. Depending on the zoom level, markers will be displayed separately, or grouped as a single Marker.
This abstract class provides the framework. Sub-classes have to implement the clustering algorithm, and the rendering of a cluster.

Author:
M.Kergall

setIcon

public void setIcon(Bitmap icon)
Set the cluster icon to be drawn when a cluster contains more than 1 marker. If not set, default will be the default osmdroid marker icon (which is really inappropriate as a cluster icon).

add

public void add(Marker marker)
Add the Marker. Important: Markers added in a MarkerClusterer should not be added in the map overlays.

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Force a rebuild of clusters at next draw, even without a zooming action. Should be done when you changed the content of a MarkerClusterer.

getItem

public Marker getItem(int id)
Returns:
the Marker at id (starting at 0)
